timeline.bodyText: Too much information about the underlying implementation is spilled over to the Authenticator. This makes the Authenticator fragile. In the case a different approach to represent JWT is chosen, Authenticator would have to be changed. Consider creating another layer of abstraction. You can either make JWTInfoDto an entity class by adding JWT related methods, or create a new class for handling JWT related stuff.
timeline.author: jaadds

timeline.bodyText: These methods too should go into a different entity class, rather than into a Util method. Now the GatewayUtil is coupled with the implementation of the JWT.
timeline.author: jaadds

timeline.bodyText: Improper use of exceptions. This is going to cause performance issues down the line. Better replace it with a logic that checks validity.

replies.bodyText:
OK, understood how it works. We may not have to necessarily change the approach, but need to think about the following scenarios;
a. Can the component startup order affect the logic?
b. How easy is for the developer to write an extension. Now they need to know certain things about OSGI as well.
We might not have to address these through code, but at least have to provide a good document around doing b .
